When a link to a file is entered in the address bar (e.g. in my case, a *.docx file), Firefox will not render a page but will open a download dialog. However, the file I was trying to access on an internal server was protected in a way that I had to enter credentials in the HTTP Authentication dialog that popped up. Underneath the address bar, Firefox displayed the tooltip-type window offering to remember the password. But after I entered my credentials and clicked OK, the open-file dialog popped up and immediately dismissed the remember-password dialog so I could not interact with it.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Navigate to a file for which Firefox would not render a page but would simply open a "download file" dialog; the path much be restricted and must require credentials to be entered.
2. Enter credentials in the dialog that pops up.
3. Click OK (or whatever button submits the credentials and dismisses the dialog).
Actual Results:  
Try to click on the "remember password" window, but cannot; disappears immediately when the "download file" dialog appears.

Expected Results:  
Would be able to still click on the "remember password" window.
